SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

visualcryptography.matrix
Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
  visualcryptography.matrix.Matrix

public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object

The Matrix class is the holder of the object created by the MatrixConstructor object. It also facilitates various operations to the Matrix itself.

Field Summary
private  int cols
          The column count of the matrix object.
private  int[][] M
          2 Dimensional array of integers.
private  int rows
          The row count of the matrix object.
 
Constructor Summary
Matrix(int height, int width)
          Constructor is used to create a (height)x(width) matrix M of integers.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String convertToString()
          Convert the content of the matrix M into its string representation.
 void delCol(int col)
          Deletes the column col in the matrix M, where 0 <= col <= cols - 1.
 void delRow(int row)
          Deletes the row row in the matrix M, where 0 <= row <= rows - 1.
 int getElement(int row, int col)
          Returns the (row, col) element of the matrix M.
 void insertCol(int[] col, int n)
          Inserts the col[] in the (n + 1)th column in the matrix where 0 <= n <= cols.
 void insertRow(int[] row, int n)
          Inserts the row[] in the (n + 1)th row in the matrix where 0 <= n <= rows.
 void Matrix()
          Constructor is used to create a 0x0 matrix M.
 int numCols()
          Returns the number of columns in the matrix M
 int numRows()
          Returns the number of rows in the matrix M.
 void permuteCols()
          Randomly permutes the columns of the matrix.
 void setElement(int row, int col, int value)
          Sets the entry (row, col) of the matrix M into value.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Constructor Detail

Matrix

public Matrix(int height,
              int width)
Constructor is used to create a (height)x(width) matrix M of integers.

Method Detail

Matrix

public void Matrix()
Constructor is used to create a 0x0 matrix M. Rows and Columns can be inserted later using insertRow(int[], int) and insertCol(int[], int).

numRows

public int numRows()
Returns the number of rows in the matrix M.

numCols

public int numCols()
Returns the number of columns in the matrix M

getElement

public int getElement(int row,
                      int col)
Returns the (row, col) element of the matrix M.

setElement

public void setElement(int row,
                       int col,
                       int value)
Sets the entry (row, col) of the matrix M into value.

permuteCols

public void permuteCols()
Randomly permutes the columns of the matrix.

insertRow

public void insertRow(int[] row,
                      int n)
Inserts the row[] in the (n + 1)th row in the matrix where 0 <= n <= rows.

insertCol

public void insertCol(int[] col,
                      int n)
Inserts the col[] in the (n + 1)th column in the matrix where 0 <= n <= cols.

delRow

public void delRow(int row)
Deletes the row row in the matrix M, where 0 <= row <= rows - 1.

delCol

public void delCol(int col)
Deletes the column col in the matrix M, where 0 <= col <= cols - 1.

convertToString

public java.lang.String convertToString()
Convert the content of the matrix M into its string representation. The columns are seperated by tabs and rows are by newlines.

Submit a bug or feature at laizzez_faire07(@)yahoo.com. Visual Cryptography is an implementation of the newly discovered and developed visual encryption algorithm by Naor and Shamir at the Eurocrypt 1994. Copyright 2005 University of the Philippines, Los Ba±os, Laguna. All rights reserved.
